sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>turtle shell</radical> radical and the <kanji>turtle shell</kanji> kanji are exactly the same! Oddly, this can also be used to talk about the first item in a list, so to mean <kanji>A</kanji> out of A through D, for example.
readingMnemonic: With a <kanji>turtle shell</kanji> on his back, imagine <ja><reading>こう</reading>いち</ja>.
readingInfo: Because this is WaniKani, <ja>こういち</ja> has probably set the turtle shell on fire, too. "Burn those turtle shells, burn those kanji!" he yells.
